titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lester Afflick Papers MSS.097
titlestmt.author: Koo Lee in March 2001. Updated by Zachary Dobbs, 2009.

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from Afflickfinaid.doc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-20 17:09:57 -0400.

did.abstract: Lester Afflick was a downtown poet, writer and once co-editor of 'The Door Newsletter.' The collection is an assemblage of his writings and biographical material which illustrate aspects of his style and the downtown scene in general of the 1990's.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open without restrictions. Please contact the Fales Library & Special Collections for more information and to schedule an appointment, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Lester Afflick papers were a gift of the Lester Afflick estate. They were initially sorted by friends of Lester Afflick.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lester Afflick was a downtown poet, writer and once co-editor of 'The Door Newsletter.' The collection is an assemblage of his writings and biographical material which illustrate aspects of his style and the downtown scene in general of the 1990's. Afflick died of a heart attack in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Lester Afflick papers are comprised mostly of correspondence and manuscripts of his poetry.
Series 1: Correspondence contains correspondence to and from Afflick. It is arranged in chronological order with the exception of a folder of correspondence with Martin Afflick.
Series 2: Manuscripts consists of three subseries.

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: Subseries A contains materials and drafts of Afflick's poetry. They are arranged alphabetically according to a comprehensive list provided by Afflick.
Subseries B contains materials from poetry collections and projected collections. The last folder contains a comprehensive list of Afflick's poems.
Subseries C contains materials manuscripts of plays, essays, and articles.
Subseries D contains disks of Afflick and printouts from those working disks.

scopecontent.p: Series 3: Biographic Materials contains a small number of biographic materials such as copies of Afflick's birth certificate, announcements, immigration papers, and scrapbooks.

Series 4: Afflick's Personal Library consists of periodicals in Afflick's collection including The Door Newsletter of which he was a co-editor. This series also includes manuscripts of other poets' works.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders arranged chronologically or alphabetically depending on the nature of the series. Correspondence is arranged chronologically. Poetry is arranged alphabetically by title.
The files are grouped into 4 series.

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: Series IV: Works by Other Writers/Poets

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: There is no information about materials that are associated by provenance to the described materials that have been physically separated or removed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Lester Afflick Papers; MSS 097; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Lester Afflick, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

odd.head: Note on Folder Numbering
odd.p: In March 2009, folder numbers in Box 4 were changed. For citation purposes, the changes are tracked below:
Subseries B, Folders 1 - 10: no change. Subseries C: former folder 1 is now 11 former folder 2 is now 12 former folder 3 is now 13 Subseries D:

former folder 1 is now 14 former folder 2 is now 15 former folder 3 is now 16 former folder 4 is now 17 former folder 5 is now 18 former folder 6 is now 19 former folder 7 is now 20 former folder 8 is now 21 former folder 9 is now 22
